page.title: 17MARYC.CLUB FOOTBALL TEAM
page.content: Maryculter Eagles are a junior football team formed of children from Maryculter East Primary School and the early years of Cults Academy Secondary School. They play league fixtures and this year have won the Drum'Culter Trophy.Perhaps the most unique feature is the 2-hour training session held by ex-international goalkeeper Bobby Clark each week. Children of all ages and both sexes turn out for this. Mums and Dads watch too. The children have a series of exercises and warm-ups, finishing with a short game. The football strip is a yellow T-shirt with a magnificent flying eagle on the back. There is also an eagle mascot which is carried aloft to matches. It was made by one of our Mums.
